briefdescription.para: Construct the vector with all components as 0.
Construct the vector with provided components.
Gets the X component.
Set the X component.
Gets the Y component.
Set the Y component.
Gets the Z component.
Set the Z component.
Gets the floored value of the X component, indicating the block that this vector is contained with.
Gets the floored value of the Y component, indicating the block that this vector is contained with.
Gets the floored value of the Z component, indicating the block that this vector is contained with.
Gets the magnitude of the vector, defined as sqrt(x^2+y^2+z^2).
Gets the magnitude of the vector squared.
Get the distance between this vector and another.
Get the squared distance between this vector and another.
Gets the angle between this vector and another in radians.
Sets this vector to the midpoint between this vector and another.
Gets a new midpoint vector between this vector and another.
Calculates the dot product of this vector with another. The dot product is defined as x1*x2+y1*y2+z1*z2. The returned value is a scalar.
Calculates the cross-product of this vector with another.

detaileddescription.para:
The cross-product is defined as:
x = y1 * z2 - y2 * z1
y = z1 * x2 - z2 * x1
z = x1 * y2 - x2 * y1

briefdescription.para: Calculates the cross-product of this vector with another without mutating the original.

detaileddescription.para:
The cross-product is defined as:
x = y1 * z2 - y2 * z1
y = z1 * x2 - z2 * x1
z = x1 * y2 - x2 * y1

briefdescription.para: Converts this vector to a unit vector (a vector with length of 1).
Zero this vector's components.
Check whether or not each component of this vector is equal to 0.

simplesect.para: true if equal to zero, false if at least one component is non-zero

briefdescription.para: Converts each component of value -0.0 to 0.0.
Returns whether this vector is in an axis-aligned bounding box.

detaileddescription.para: The minimum and maximum vectors given must be truly the minimum and maximum X, Y and Z components.

simplesect.para: whether this vector is in the AABB

briefdescription.para: Returns whether this vector is within a sphere.

simplesect.para: whether this vector is in the sphere

briefdescription.para: Returns if a vector is normalized.
Rotates the vector around the x-axis.

parameterdescription.para: the angle to rotate the vector about. This angle is passed in radians

briefdescription.para: Rotates the vector around the y-axis.

parameterdescription.para: the angle to rotate the vector about. This angle is passed in radians

briefdescription.para: Rotates the vector around the z-axis.

parameterdescription.para: the angle to rotate the vector about. This angle is passed in radians

briefdescription.para: Rotates the vector around a given arbitrary axis in 3-dimensional space.

detaileddescription.para: Rotation will follow the general Right-Hand-Rule, which means rotation will be counterclockwise when the axis is pointing towards the observer.

This method will always make sure the provided axis is a unit vector, to not modify the length of the vector when rotating. If you are experienced with the scaling of a non-unit axis vector, you can use rotateAroundNonUnitAxis(Vector, float).

parameterdescription.para: the axis to rotate the vector around. If the passed vector is not of length 1, it gets normalized before using it for the rotation.
the angle to rotate the vector around the axis

briefdescription.para: Rotates the vector around a given arbitrary axis in 3-dimensional space.

detaileddescription.para: Rotation will follow the general Right-Hand-Rule, which means rotation will be counterclockwise when the axis is pointing towards the observer.

Note that the vector length will change accordingly to the axis vector length. If the provided axis is not a unit vector, the rotated vector will not have its previous length. The scaled length of the resulting vector will be related to the axis vector. If you are not sure about the scaling of the vector, use rotateAroundAxis(Vector, float).

parameterdescription.para: the axis to rotate the vector around.
the angle to rotate the vector around the axis

briefdescription.para: Represents a 3-dimensional vector.
